programmes.show_description: Learn how they turn a family car into a tough rally car, and how they make titanium, the metal that the modern aerospace industry relies on? S4, Ep2
How do submarine crews survive submerged beneath the ocean for months at a time? Plus, how do crash test dummies make driving safer? S4, Ep3
Get behind the wheel of the world's biggest land vehicles as they mine 90,000 tons of coal a day, and hunt for alligators in the Florida swamps. S4, Ep4
How do structure movers shift steam turbines that weigh more than ten houses; and how are black boxes built to survive plane crashes? S4, Ep5
Saab 900. Mike thinks there's money to be made on a soft-top Saab 900, but it's got a dodgy clutch and woolly steering. Can Elvis get it back to its best? S18, Ep3
Subaru BRZ. Mike buys his newest ever car to create a bespoke Scooby BRZ STI. But hopes of a profit are hit with a hefty bill for the turbo and a new exhaust. S18, Ep4
Standard 14. Henry and Fuzz head to Bristol to help Russell revive his 1947 Standard 14: a post-war classic with charm, history, and plenty of hidden troubles. S3, Ep9
More everyday items go under the microscope. How are objects including Marseille soap and Laguiole pocket knives made? S25, Ep8
More everyday items go under the microscope. How are objects including cinnamon cordial and homemade rasps made? S25, Ep9
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
Hudson Hornet. Wayne chased a Hudson Italia for 38 years before he acquired one from a kindly angel called Hazel, but does she have any other surprises left up her sleeve? S6, Ep1
Amelia Island. Wayne heads to The Amelia Island Concours and auctions to sell a 1955 Mercedes-Benz 190sl and 280se Cabriolet, one of which sells for a potential world record price. S6, Ep2
Micro Cars. Cute sells and the Bruce Weiner Microcar Museum sale is no exception. With his eye out for a BMW Isetta for his newly married daughter, Wayne is in the right place. S6, Ep3
Packards. Wayne heads to an auction of unusual cars, where a 1937 Packard Convertible catches his eye. But how far will he be willing to go to secure a deal? S6, Ep4
Ford Fiesta XR2. Mike decides to go back to the 80s and bags a bargain example of one of his dream cars - but can they only spend £1000 on repairs to ensure a profit? S11, Ep1
Citroen HY Van. Mike goes to France in search of a retro-cool Citroen HY Van. Edd isn't impressed with his spoils, knowing it will be a costly renovation. But can they find a buyer? S12, Ep16
Mini Mark 1 850. Mike finds his favourite iconic British car, a Mini Mark 1, in a garage in Wales. He and Elvis make some radical changes to get it back on the road. S17, Ep1
Toyota Landcruiser. Mike and Elvis tackle a classic Toyota Landcruiser. Mike takes a gamble and imports an original 70s one from Japan, not knowing what state it will arrive in. S18, Ep6
Ford Escort MK1. Mike picks up a cracking three-door Ford MK1 for £4,500 in an internet auction. Can Edd's restoration help them make a profit on this nifty 70s classic? S10, Ep2
Merkur XR4Ti. Mike gets nostalgic in a 1985 Merkur XR4Ti - AKA the Ford Sierra. He has found a rare competition shell model and Ant applies some unique European touches. S15, Ep25
Range Rover. Mike buys a bargain Range Rover P38 and Edd sets about mending it. They head to the wilds of Exmoor to give the car a final test drive before searching for a buyer. S8, Ep3
Graham Steeler. Henry and Fuzz head to Southend to visit Graham's shed full of bikes and muscle cars. They find a Dutton kit car and rows and rows of rare bikes. S6, Ep16
Will Ralph. Henry and Fuzz visit a farm near Colchester with vintage tractors galore. The boys come away with a classic Fordson and some old traffic lights. S6, Ep17
Robin Burford. The boys visit Rob, who has an impressive collection of vintage British bikes. They find a BSA Bantam and a classic 1930's Austin Ten automobile. S6, Ep18
Paul Webb. Henry and Fuzz visit Paul in the Malvern Hills, a man with a perfectly maintained collection of Japanese motorbikes including a Honda 750 Four. S6, Ep19
Frank. Henry and Fuzz are in Moretonhampstead at Frank's motoring museum - home to hundreds of cars, bikes and rare pieces of motoring memorabilia. S6, Ep20
Stuart. Henry and Fuzz find a Triumph Terrier in Oxfordshire. Can they breathe life into this little legend and get it back on the road? S7, Ep1
Chris. In Cambridgeshire, Henry and Fuzz uncover a Suzuki GSXR Slingshot. Can they tame this superbike and bring it roaring back to life? S7, Ep2
Rob. Henry and Fuzz visit Rob in Cambridgeshire and find vintage agricultural gems. Can they get some old workhorses running and make a profit? S7, Ep3
Tickled Pink. The Cog respray an Aston Martin Lagonda a shocking pink for Europe's biggest car collector. Richard's daughter Izzy discovers a passion for racing. S5, Ep2
Susan hopes restoration expert Steve can bring her once beautiful trinket back to life. Plus, Dominic revives a beloved wedding present, a Georgian peat bucket. S5, Ep46
The expert restorers revive a rusty child's bike with a romantic connection, a fluffy monkey that provided support, and a lamp smashed into pieces. S8, Ep7
Railway Relics & A Harley Hog. Angus steams into a train treasure trove while helping a bereaved daughter, then hopes to turn a campervan dream into reality with a Harley sale. S6, Ep17
In The Trenches. The Misfits return to their claim and find it's been soaked by torrential rain. The Opal Lovers dig a deep trench on their Digger's Gully claim. S8, Ep15
Beware Of The Locals. Camille and Hannah hunt on Springbank Island in the middle of Lake Burley Griffin. Andrew and Mish make some illuminating finds. S1, Ep7
Monster In The Abyss. Experts investigate the disappearance of people who have gone missing while swimming in the Triangle. Some locals believe a sea monster is responsible. S1, Ep3
US Navy Vs The Triangle. New discoveries might finally explain the truth behind one of the Triangle's most infamous mysteries, when 306 US Navy crewmen vanished without a trace. S1, Ep4
Discover how wax figures, awnings, sandwich crackers and pewter tankards are made. S18, Ep5
Find out how common items like pipe cleaners, blue stilton cheese, smart electric meters and telescopes are made. S18, Ep6
More everyday items are put under the microscope. How are common objects including berets, pastis, and stationary bikes made? S25, Ep10
More everyday items go under the microscope. How are objects including bamboo ceramic lights and asphalt compactors made? S25, Ep11

programmes.show_name: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programmes.show_description: Simon believes he can make a huge profit on a rare Raleigh Chopper and a petrol can. Meanwhile, Henry plans to revamp a hank crank petrol pump. S3, Ep14

programmes.show_name: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programmes.show_description: In Devon, Simon O'Brien breaks a snare drum and reluctantly agrees to give it a revamp. Henry Cole takes a risk on a broken gramophone and a rusty churn. S3, Ep15

programmes.show_name: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programmes.show_description: In Tiverton, Henry Cole uncovers some tarnished scales and an original Lambretta scooter. Simon O'Brien wants to revive a bland table and a petrol gauge. S3, Ep16
Arusha Irvine and Angus Ashworth begin their road trip in Northern Ireland. Who will collect the most profit at the first auction in Wrexham? S19, Ep16
Angus Ashworth and Arusha Irvine travel around Wales in their Rolls-Royce Silver Shadow. Who will make the most profit at the auction in Carmarthen? S19, Ep17
Angus Ashworth and Arusha Irvine continue their hunt for hidden gems in Ammanford. They uncover a top hot, gold plated spectacles and a travel set. S19, Ep18
Arusha Irvine and Angus Ashworth search for interesting items in Barnstaple. And, Arusha visits Exmoor National Park to take a ride on a unique pony. S19, Ep19
Antiques experts Arusha Irvine and Angus Ashworth embark on the last leg of their road trip. Who will be victorious at the final auction in Clevedon? S19, Ep20
Paper conservator Louise freshens up a treasured pastel portrait from 1993. Meanwhile, Steve is challenged with fixing up a very precious tin plate rocket. S6, Ep5
Woodwork expert Will and upholsterer Sonnaz work together to restore a very fragile chair. Meanwhile, Suzie attempts to revive a precious fireman's hat. S6, Ep6
First up, Brenton is challenged with restoring a vintage vest pocket Kodak camera. Plus, ceramics expert Kirsty pieces together a decorative marble platter. S6, Ep7
Angus and the team clear out a farmhouse in Cumbria. They uncover some wonderful antiques, including a box of collectable toy cars and a 19th century bureau. S1, Ep1
Railway Relics & A Harley Hog. Angus steams into a train treasure trove while helping a bereaved daughter, then hopes to turn a campervan dream into reality with a Harley sale. S6, Ep17
Angus helps Claire Richards by taking a huge chunk of pop memorabilia to auction. And he finds a blunderbuss and chastity belt in Amanda Owen's home. S5, Ep1
Woodwork expert Will fixes up a ship that is made entirely from matchsticks. Plus, Sonnaz and Dominic work together to restore a beloved vintage chair. S6, Ep8
The team restores a 1950s hot towel machine for a family of Cypriot barbers, a ceramic poppy created for the WW1 centenary and a precious portrait. S8, Ep54
Paper conservator Louise freshens up a treasured pastel portrait from 1993. Meanwhile, Steve is challenged with fixing up a very precious tin plate rocket. S6, Ep5
